intro: Sebastiania albicans, commonly known as the white sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its attractive, white, waxy flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling small lanterns. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Sebastiania albicans is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
